Be It Enacted By The Parliament Of The Democratic Socialist Republic Of Sri Lanka As Follows:-

child_level_list.text: This Act may be cited as the Kandyan Marriage and Divorce (Amendment) Act, No. 37 of 2022.
Part II (sections 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14 and 15) of the Kandyan Marriage and Divorce Act (Chapter 113) (hereinafter referred to as the principal enactment) is hereby repealed.
pre_block_list: Repeal of Part II of Chapter 113

Section 18 of the principal enactment is hereby amended, by the repeal of paragraph (5) thereof and the substitution therefor, of the following paragraph:-
pre_block_list: Amendment of section 18 of the principal enactment

child_level_list.text: Any party to the marriage who desires to obtain a marriage notice certificate from a District
pre_block_list: Registrar before the expiry of the period referred to in paragraph (3) ( a ) (i) or paragraph (4) ( a ) (i) or paragraph (4) ( c ) (ii) of this section shall appear in person before that Registrar and make and subscribe a declaration to the effect that there is no lawful impediment or other lawful hindrance to the marriage.

child_level_list.text: The declaration shall be accompanied by a receipt issued by the District Registrar in proof of payment of the prescribed fee which shall be made by the party making the declaration

Section 60 of the principal enactment is hereby repealed and the following section is substituted therefor:-
pre_block_list: Replacement of section 60 of the principal enactment

60. Any person who, for the purpose of procuring the solemnization or registration of a Kandyan marriage knowingly or wilfully makes and subscribes any false declaration or signs any false notice, under this Act shall be guilty of an offence under this Act

child_level_list.text: Section 66 of the principal enactment is hereby amended  by the repeal of the definition of the expression minor.
pre_block_list: Amendment of section 66 of the principal enactment

child_level_list.text: For avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that-
the provisions of this Act shall not apply to any Kandyan marriage contracted prior to the date of commencement of this Act; and

the provisions of subsections (2) and (3) of section 4 of the principal enactment shall not apply to any Kandyan marriage contracted on or after the date of commencement of this Act, save as provided for in section 112 of the Evidence Ordinance (Chapter 14).
In the event of any inconsistency between the Sinhala and Tamil texts of this Act, the Sinhala text shall prevail.
pre_block_list: Sinhala text to prevail in case of inconsistency
